Reviews.Title: “First time in Wimbeldon hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bessum
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for three nights while attending a family funeral. Myself, sister and three elderly aunts were treated very well and sensitively due to our sad circumstances. Our rooms were appointed to suit each of our needs and were immaculately clean. Memory mattress and pillows were really comfortable. Breakfast was freshly cooked and of good quality ingredients. Unlimited tea, coffee and toast was served by Sandra who was a breath of fresh air who could not do enough for us. Jay the owner made us feel like we were staying in a home. It was a guest house so perhaps it's name could mislead those expecting a lounge, bar etc but this was not a problem for us. I always stay in large hotels but will Definately be rethinking this in future. I hope to return in happier times and would highly recommend this to anyone wishing to stay in Wimbeldon.

Reviews.Title: “OK for one night”
Reviews.Author: NicolaJShu
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night and the hotel is clean and in a greta location. A little noisy as on the main road and no double-glazing but perfectly adequate for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent cosy home from home.”
Reviews.Author: Laura B
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in several hotels/B&Bs in the Wimbledon area and found the Wimbledon Hotel to be the best. It has a more homely feel than most and the standard of the room I had was excellent, especially the divine memory foam mattress and pillows. Staff are very friendly and accommodating, my only criticism would be that the breakfast could be a lot better. Will definitely stay again, and would highly recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Not a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: RMorley
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for one night very recently and booked online. On arrival we were charged a slightly different price from the one quoted on the booking and given a different style of room. As my husband and I arrived at different times we did not realise the mistake until late that evening. Unfortunately the hotel has limited reception cover so no-one was available to speak to about this. To add to all of this, on arrival my husband was greeted by someone who opened the door but did not speak at all and just left him standing there! The rooms are over-crowded with furniture that serves little purpose other than aesthetics and made it difficult for two of us to move around and get to one side of the bed. The room was also quite hot and, due to the large piece of furniture in front of the window, it was difficult to ventilate it. The rooms also lack any bedside lighting so you cannot read in bed. The bathroom is adequate but strangely they give you a bottle of handwash instead of shower gel - not very boutique! Unfortunately the hoise created by other guests moving around is bad. Not the fault of the guest but simply due to very creaky floorboards and obviously no carpeting to muffle sound so we endured a very bad night's sleep. We left the hotel very early so missed breakfast (which is charged at GBP7 per person) but it sounds like we did not miss much given the reviews on here. I wrote a review of our stay at the hotel as requested by the owners but to date no-one has bothered to contact me nor have they posted it on their site, which is understandable, but clearly there is little point in providing them with feedback. Wimbledon doesn't have a great number of hotels (Antoinette is probably the only similarly priced one) so you are limited by choice but there are better options nearby than the Wimbledon Hotel and not worth the GBP95 we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for visiting the City”
Reviews.Author: Deborah R
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Boutique style hotel. Very clean well situated for visiting the city and other areas. Very friendly host and 'Free Parking' which cuts down the cost to visiting London. 10 mins from the Tube (District Line). Highly recomended as we took a trip to Hampton Court as well and only 20mins drive away Â£4 parking for the day so a great day out. Will definatly use again when visiting London. Did not have the breakfast but it looked very good and would book this on our next visit. Owner very helpful and obliging....

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean room, very friendly owner and staff, more like a B&B than a 'hotel'”
Reviews.Author: BnBfanHK
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by the owner when we arrived, very friendly and helpful, since we were attending a wedding, the owner was very helpful in arranging a taxi for us to the venue but unfortunately the taxi arrived with a 40-minute delay, it wasn't the hotel's fault but it may not be a good idea to order a taxi when the match is on. Our room was a 'European style' room, very comfortable, clean the bathroom is spacious, modern and clean. There were tea and coffee making facilities and some shortbread. We ordered breakfast, the toast was good, so was the tea, we particularly liked the fresh fruit salad.

Reviews.Title: “OK but don't bother with breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Tollers099
Reviews.Content: Over priced but it was Wimbledon fortnight so you expect to pay a premium. In normal times I would expect to pay no more than Â£100 per night. Breakfast was a waste of time. Tea out of a flask, overcooked eggs, twice, and cheap sausages. For Â£7.50 you can get a great breakfast in the town or up the hill in the village.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: daveandmelgreen
Reviews.Content: Good that there's car parking although spaces could be more clearly marked. Warmly greeted by proprietor. Tried to tell us that check in was at 2 p.m. when we clearly had a booking reservation that showed check in as 11 a.m. Hate it when someone's wrong and can't admit it or tries to tell you it's not them but you who has it wrong! Also charged us more than we thought for the room. To be fair I didn't challenge him but it left me feeling uncomfortable. Room was very nice and clean, well decorated. Bed was comfortable. But they only had large bottles of toiletries. When I tried to use the shower gel it had 'gunck' in the end of the dispenser. Breakfast was o.k. but sausages probably the worst and cheapest I've ever had in a hotel / B&B. Got the impression they were trying to scrimp in some areas with little regard for quality of their guests experience and more regard for the money going into their pockets. Got the balance slightly wrong here! Overall it was an o.k hotel but the little things stopped it from being a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: SHVRome
Reviews.Content: Calling itself a Boutique Hotel I expected a lot more from it. Apart from the renovations which were ongoing (which we weren't informed of previously), I found the room disappointing. Although an effort had been made with the soft furnishings, generally the room just looked cheap. The only toiletry provided in the bathroom was handsoap (even in the basic Travellodges you get showergel provided) and the shower was awful (alternating between boiling /freezing and didn't drain so it fills up with water). The spare toilet roll was on the floor and was covered in hair from floor sweeping - yuck! We didn't try the breakfast. Luckily we weren't caught out by it, but they have a cut-off time for arrivals after which the front door gets locked - something to be aware of.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunately not the same under new management”
Reviews.Author: theplane
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel 6 times over the past 18 months, and I thought I had found a real gem. Everything was always "just so", prices were fixed (and reasonable), and the people running it (family-run hotel) were warm and helpful. For this last stay in December (3rd week of December), I found that it all started to go wrong in the booking process. Calling and getting different prices from the same person manning the phone (ranging from 140GBP a night to 80GBP a night) was the first unpleasant experience. Since the prices quoted matched those of a Hilton in Central London, and somewhat protesting the inconsistent pricing, I booked the first few days of my holiday at the Hilton (internet and breakfast included). However, for my last few days, I had no choice but to stay at the Wimbledon given that my fiancee's family live close to it, and I was going to have a few late-night Christmas and New Year celebration evenings there. When I moved to the hotel, I was unhappy that I had been put in a basement room which smelled like stale beer, was very cold, and the television could only be watched if you were standing up (even sitting on the bed, it was so high up that the image was completely distorted). Outside the room, the carpet was dirty, worn, and not even held down in some places. The walls were peeling, and the yellowy-brown lighting was more akin to a cheap bar than a place you'd want to spend the night. Once again, it wasn't what I was accustomed to at the hotel, and even less so considering that most of the other rooms were empty. And certainly a shock moving from the Hilton to this, at the same prices. The next straw to hit the camel's back was the manager chasing me out the door one morning while I was running to catch the bus (which I almost missed because of him). The reason he was chasing me was to ask me for the key and payment because he thought I was checking out. I then informed him that, as per my reservation, I still had 3 days to go at the hotel, and wasn't going to check out just yet. Unfortunately, whereas before I used to recommend this hotel to everyone I knew, it has now fallen into my Hotels to Avoid list

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable but don't have the breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Lin6663
Reviews.Content: Let me temper this review by saying that we really liked the proprietor who we found to be friendly and helpful, but this hotel has recently changed hands and the new owners are clearly still finding their feet. We were greeted warmly on arrival by the proprietor who checked us in very efficiently and quickly. We were asked whether we required breakfast (Â£7.50 extra per person) and were surprised that we had to order it by filling out a form the night before,specifying what time we wanted to eat it. The latter requirement being rather difficult to estimate since we were attending a wedding and really had no idea what time we were likely to get back to the hotel, let alone know how much of a lie-in we would want after the festivities! The proprietor was very helpful in arranging a taxi for us to the venue and he was chatty and interesting. He was due to celebrate Diwali with his family that evening and kindly offered us some sweetmeats he had on hand. Our room was right at the top of the building (a large converted house) so quite a trek up several flights of stairs and I would say that it isn't really suitable for anyone with mobility difficulties. The room, when we got there, was clean and comfortable and really nicely decorated. The en-suite shower room was very modern and clean and there were plenty of toiletries available. We had a comfortable night's sleep and had no complaints about the facilities in the room - the linen was scrupulously clean, there were tea and coffee making facilities and there were extra pillows if required. Having specified that we wanted our breakfast at 9am we made sure we were up and dressed in plenty of time and were sitting in the dining room by 8.50am. There was no-one else in the dining room when we got there and we were quickly greeted by a young woman who appeared from the kitchen and told us we could sit anywhere. She asked us our room number and having established our preferred tea and toast options she disappeared back into the kitchen, reappearing rather swiftly with these items. So far so good! At this point other guests started to appear and this is when things started to go wrong. It seems that this poor lady is responsible not only for showing guests to their tables but also for making the tea and toast, serving the breakfast and topping up the preserves, butter, juices etc. AND for cooking the breakfast itself Rather too many responsibilities for one person! Although we had personally handed our breakfast order to the proprietor the night before, it could not be found in the morning and from what we could gather some other guestsâ€™ orders had also mysteriously disappeared. This really put the cat amongst the pigeons as the whole system fell down.This poor woman became confused and flustered and people started to randomly receive breakfasts. We were rather annoyed that others who had arrived in the dining room several minutes after us were happily tucking in whilst we were still waiting . When the breakfast did finally arrive Iâ€™m sorry to say it really wasnâ€™t worth the half hour wait â€“ cold, tasteless and very crispy bacon; cheap, overcooked sausages and cold baked beans â€“ not great really. The toast was very nice though, as was the tea - just a pity that they were both finished long before the breakfast arrived! Put it this way - our breakfast was placed in front of us at around 9.20am and by 9.30am we had eaten as much of it as we liked and were in the car heading off on our journey home. In short, my recommendation would be stay here if you want a clean, comfortable, reasonably priced room, but have your breakfast somewhere else! Had we not decided to have breakfast at the hotel I think I would have rated it more highly on my review but having decided to eat there in the morning it did take the shine off things somewhat, as not only was the service rather disorganised but the food itself was not of a particularly good quality and therefore we ended up feeling a little ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “small but comfortable family run B and B/guest house, good old fashioned service”
Reviews.Author: harraby
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Wimbledon hotel with other family members and a toddler ,staff very pleasant and helpful, bed rooms all clean each one a different style of decor, with en -suite facilities in each room some of the ensuites were smaller than others ,ours was quite compact., there were fans provided in each room ,but no air conditioning . We enjoyed a very nice breakfast in the dining room each morning ,but no childrens chairs were provided , there is no bar facilities and no lifts ,access to the rooms was via very narrow steep stairs over two upper floors

Reviews.Title: “Hotel or "B&B"”
Reviews.Author: Luton-Laddie
Reviews.Content: Having checked out the hotels in Wimbledon on various websites, this one seemed to get the best reviews. Quite why this is classed as a hotel and not a B&B, I'm not sure. No evening meals are available, (just breakfast) no bar facilities and reception only open from 0930 in the morning to 2130 at night. We booked a room for one night costing Â£85, not including breakfast, which was an extra Â£6.50 per person. Be advised that the main stairway leading to the rooms is very narrow and might be a struggle if you have big cases with you. Having opened the door to our room, we were immediately confronted by another door, (think this was a fire door) which made it a bit awkward getting in and out. The room itself was very small & â€œbijouâ€�, but clean and neat, with scatter cushions on bed and rugs hanging on the wall etc. The bathroom could have really done with a power-shower though as the the flow wasnâ€™t much more than a trickle! The website describes the rooms as having "multi-media" facilities, although during our stay, the PC/DVD had no power to it. Overall, it is a clean and compact â€œhotelâ€� within walking distance of the centre of Wimbledon, but donâ€™t get fooled by fact it calls itself a hotel when it is really a rather expensive B&B.

Reviews.Title: “Small and sweet”
Reviews.Author: joolzpop
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on the internet. friends of ours were getting married nearby and i don't do travelodges. It is easy to miss from the outside but very attractive and well located for the tube. The decor in the rooms was quite contemporary and orientally influenced. On the other hand the service was good old-fashioned British hotel with a tasty (and very reasonable) breakfast served in an airy dining room and a member of staff on reception all day. I thought the price (Â£85 per night for a spacious double) was very good for Central London and I'd be happy to stay again. LCD TV and DVD or CD playback are available and movies etc can be hired.

HotelInfo.Name: Wimbledon Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 78 Worple Road | Wimbledon, London SW19 4HZ, England
